desc: An Initiative by Sri Sai Ram Siddha Medical Students
welcome: Hello! Our Corona Virus Self-Assessment Scan was developed based on the guidance of WHO and the Government of India, MHFW. This contact should not be taken as an expert medical advice. Any information you share with us will be kept confidential.
head: Headache
temperature: Report your current body temperature (normal body temperature is 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit / 37 ° C):
syptomscan: Do you have any of the symptoms below?
smell: Loss or Dimnished Sense of Smell
additional: In addition, check to see if you are experiencing any of the symptoms below
travel: Select your travel and exposure details
nocontact: No contact with person the symptoms
nojourney: History of travel or encounter in the affected geographical area over the past 14 days
hadcontact: Been in contact with a confirmed COVID patient for the past 14 days
specialconditions: Do you have a history of any of these conditions (mark all applicable)
conditionsymp: How have your symptoms improved over the past 48 hours?
precautions1: Consult a doctor immediately and isolate at home.
precautions2: Laboratory tests and imaging may be needed as per your physician's advise
precautions3: COVID 19 testing may be required at your physician’s advise
precautions4: Monitor your symptoms and get medical attention if your situation worsens
precautions5: Prevention and Precautions - Basic protective measures
precautions6: Be aware or Educate yourself with the latest updates on the following websites : WHO & MoHFW
precautions7: Most people who become infected experience mild illness and recover, but it can be more severe for others. Take care of your health and protect others by doing the following:
precautions9: Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.
precautions11: Maintain at least 2 metre (6 feet) distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing.
precautions12: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
precautions13: Our hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth.
precautions15: Make sure you and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.
precautions16: If you have fever, cough and difficulty in breathing, seek medical care early
precautions17: Stay home if you feel unwell. If you have a high fever, moderate to severe cough and difficulty in breathing and it is worsening in short period of time, seek medical asistance and call in advance.
